context: nd this project by the gem consortium. the gem underrepresented minority internships in stem program is designed to build a diverse workforce in stem fields such as chemistry, engineering, and physics, by focusing on connecting underrepresented (e.g., african american, hispanic american/latino, and native american) graduate students to leading industries in the united states (us). the program provides this group of emerging talented graduate students with knowledge, mentoring, professional development, and hands-on training that will allow them to be competitive for leadership positions in these industries.
